heading: What Should You Do Now?
subHeading: Before you reply, sign, or explain anything — pause. One wrong step can cost you more than you think.

image.alt: Law books arranged on a wooden shelf

warningBox.alt: Law books arranged on a wooden shelf
warningBox.title: Anything you say or sign can be used against you.
warningBox.description: Even a quick reply, casual explanation, or “harmless” signature can weaken your position permanently.

steps.title: Pause
steps.description: Don’t reply, explain, or sign anything yet.

steps.title: Talk to an Expert
steps.description: Share everything with someone who understands the law.

steps.title: This Pause Protects You
steps.description: Silence now can save you later.

faqs.question: I just received a notice or complaint. What should I do first?
faqs.answer: Don’t reply immediately. Share it with a legal professional first so you don’t make a mistake that can be used against you.

faqs.question: Do I really need a lawyer right now?
faqs.answer: Maybe, maybe not. It depends on your situation — a quick conversation can tell you exactly what you need.

faqs.question: Can I talk to the other party directly and sort it out?
faqs.answer: Not before understanding the legal risk. Even one wrong message or call can weaken your position.

faqs.question: What if I don’t understand the legal terms in my documents?
faqs.answer: That’s normal. We’ll break everything down for you in simple language so you know what’s actually happening.
